isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - DIAGNOSTIC TOOLS AND ACCESSORIES - Using Master Diagnostics (MD 32) - EST Help

svcproc.title: EST Help
svcproc.para: This software release of Master Diagnostics has an extensive set of documentation loaded into the electronic help file. This section describes the organization and the layout of Help file.
The Help file is arranged under the following headings: Company, Introduction, How to's, Programming, Menus Toolbar, and DTCs.

The Introduction topic contains the software revision information. This topic documents the changes to software releases. Click Revision Information. It will display the software revision contained in this release.
The How to's topic describes the features of this software's usage, access, and examples. Double clicking on the heading labeled How to's will display more help functions.

The Trouble Codes (DLCII) topic contains service procedures and technical information on International engines. Placing the pointer over a DTC number or the circuit index causes the pointer to change from the shape of an arrow to the shape of a hand, indicating that these topics are hot linked.
Example: Double clicking on the DTC brings up a detailed description of possible causes. This is normally displayed when double clicking the DTC in the DTC window .

Clicking on a hot link in the circuit index will bring up a detailed description of the circuit involved with this DTC as well as others. The circuit index is also organized under topics corresponding to their related DTCs. Related circuit diagrams can be reviewed by clicking on the appropriate engine family hot link (V-8 or I-6 ).

Example: Clicking on DTC 131 brings up a window detailing more information about DTC 131. Clicking on the I-6 hot link opens up an electrical diagram and voltage/resistance checks for harnesses and connectors.
Click on the Index tab. This displays all EST HELP topic indexes. Double clicking on an index item causes the help information to be displayed.

Click on the Search tab. A search with EST HELP is done by using specific words or phrases. The advanced search feature provides conditional searches. Type in the words or phrases in the search box and click on the List Topics button. Select the topic, then click on the Display button to display the help information.
Check the Master Diagnostic Software User's Manual for questions and additional information.
